channel.title: CyberNetSec - Regulatory
channel.description: Latest regulatory threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Bank of England, has issued a public statement and roadmap advising the global financial sector to begin a coordinated transition to quantum-resilient technology. The guidance warns that advanced quantum compu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds
item.description:
The World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026' report, produced with Accenture, reveals a major shift in the threat landscape: cyber-enabled fraud and phishing have now surpassed ransomware as the top concern for global business leaders. The report highlights that fraud has rea...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach
item.description:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a major data breach affecting approximately 705,000 state residents. The breach was caused by incorrect privacy settings on internal planning maps that were inadvertently made public on a mapping website for up to four years. The exposed...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: London Councils Hit by Major Cyberattack, Resident Data Exposed
item.description:
A significant cyberattack targeting a shared IT system used by multiple London councils has resulted in a data breach exposing the sensitive personal information of thousands of residents. The incident, which affected Kensington and Chelsea Council among others, has caused widespread service disrupt...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: NIST Releases Draft Cybersecurity Framework Profile for AI
item.description:
The U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) has released a preliminary draft of a Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) Profile for Artificial Intelligence. This new guidance, intended to be used with CSF 2.0 and the AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF), aims to help organizations manage...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

item.title: CISA Adds Two New Actively Exploited Vulnerabilities to KEV Catalog
item.description:
On January 7, 2026, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added two new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The specific details of the flaws have not been disclosed, but their inclusion confirms they are under active exploitation by malic...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: New Privacy & Cybersecurity Laws Take Effect Across US States
item.description:
January 1, 2026, marked the effective date for a significant wave of new state-level privacy and cybersecurity laws in the United States. Comprehensive privacy laws are now active in Indiana, Kentucky, and Rhode Island. Concurrently, new regulations under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) c...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cognizant Sued in Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach
item.description:
IT services giant Cognizant Technology Solutions is facing multiple class-action lawsuits in the U.S. following a significant data breach at its healthcare subsidiary, TriZetto Provider Solutions (TPS). The lawsuits, filed in New Jersey and Missouri, allege that Cognizant failed to adequately protec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: Petco Data Breach Exposes Customer SSNs and Financial Info Due to Misconfiguration
item.description:
Pet product retailer Petco has disclosed a data breach caused by a software misconfiguration that left highly sensitive customer files accessible on the internet. The exposed data includes full names, Social Security numbers, driver's license numbers, and financial account details, including credit ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Regulatory

item.title: SEC Busts $14M AI-Powered Crypto Scam That Used Deepfakes
item.description:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has charged seven entities for their involvement in a sophisticated cryptocurrency investment scam that defrauded retail investors of over $14 million. The scheme, which ran for a year, used social media ads featuring deepfake videos of financial pro...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence
